Other Information.Test Conditions: 300 K, driving pressure varied from 20 to 80 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: H2 flux increases with increasing pressure and temperature; H2 molecules exhibit preferential orientation parallel to phenylimidazolate building blocks.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 300 K, driving pressure varied from 20 to 80 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 is blocked by small pore apertures of ZIF-7.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 300 K, driving pressure varied from 20 to 80 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: CO is blocked by small pore apertures of ZIF-7.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 300 K, driving pressure varied from 20 to 80 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: CH4 is blocked by small pore apertures of ZIF-7.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 300 K, driving pressure varied from 20 to 80 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: H2O is blocked by small pore apertures of ZIF-7 but exhibits strong interactions at the membrane interface.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion based on small apertures (2.9 Å) in ZIF-7 that allow only H2 to pass through.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2 permeance: 2.0 to 5.3 × 10^-8 mol m^-2 s^-1 Pa^-1; Activation energy for H2 permeation decreases with increasing driving pressure (4.50–10.09 kJ/mol).

Other Information.Additional Info: Simulation suggests ZIF-7 membrane can be used at high temperatures and pressures with good durability due to its thermal and mechanical stability.
